subject: Re: [junit] Paramaters Collection type
msgSnippet: Raphael, You re totally right.  Can you open a bug?  Thanks, David Saff
messageBody:
Raphael,

You're totally right. Can you open a bug? Thanks,

David Saff

On Wed, Oct 22, 2008 at 7:46 AM, rparree <rparree@...> wrote:
>
> Some additional information how i got to this question:
>
> I am referring to the JavaDoc and examples concerning the
> org.junit.runners.Parameterized. Within this class the computeParams cast
> the result of the @Parameters method to a List<Object[]>. Therefor i believe
> the JavaDoc should be clearer.
> The computeParams has been defined private, and is therefor no candidate to
> be overriden by a developer to support another Collection implementation. In
> order to support any other Collection implementation you would have to
> override the standard createTest. Plus specify that as the your new class as
> the runner.
>
> It's just that the JavaDoc for this implementation of Parameterized is not
> accurate, that's was my problem.
>
> rparree wrote:
>>
>> Hi,
>>
>> Is there any particular reason why the JavaDoc and numerous examples state
>> that the return of a @Parameters method is Collection, when it in fact it
>> may only be a List<Object[]>?
>>
>> tx.,
>>
>> Raphael
>>
>>
>> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>>
>>
>>
>
> --
> View this message in context:
> http://www.nabble.com/Paramaters-Collection-type-tp20108260p20109037.html
> Sent from the JUnit - User mailing list archive at Nabble.com.
